conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the given x-t graph to determine the car's acceleration.
The graph shows the position of the car as a function of time, with the position given in meters per second (m/s).
The graph is plotted on the x-axis as time (t) and on the y-axis as position (x).
The graph shows a straight line with a slope.
Identify the slope of the line on the x-t graph. The slope represents the car's acceleration.
The slope of the line is given by the change in position (x) over the change in time (t).
From the graph, the slope of the line is 10 m/s.
This indicates that the car's acceleration is 10 m/s².
Since the slope of the line is the rate of change of position with respect to time, this directly corresponds to the car's acceleration.
Verify that the slope of the line is consistent with the given position-time graph.
The slope of the line is consistent with the given position-time graph, which shows a straight line indicating constant acceleration.
Conclude that the car's acceleration from the start of timing is 10 m/s².
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 10 m/s².
